title: Implement parallel task execution safety system
description: Add file locking, conflict detection, and safe ID generation to enable parallel task execution with minimal risk of data corruption or conflicts. This implementation will allow safe concurrent Claude Code sessions working on independent tasks.
completion_notes: All 9 subtasks completed successfully. Implemented comprehensive parallel execution safety system including file locking, ID generation, conflict detection, validation gates, context coordination, atomic operations, and parallel-safe dependency analysis
notes: All subtasks complete (9/9 done) - Successfully implemented three-phase parallel safety system: Foundation (file locks, IDs), Safety (conflict detection, validation), and Coordination (context sharing, atomic ops)

assumptions.description: File locking with flock/msvcrt will work across different OS platforms
assumptions.validation_method: Test on both Unix and Windows systems

assumptions.description: Timestamp-based IDs will eliminate collision risk
assumptions.validation_method: Stress test with concurrent ID generation

assumptions.description: Performance overhead of locks will be acceptable (<20ms)

decision_rationale: Prioritizing file locking as the foundation since it prevents data corruption. Using timestamp-based IDs over UUIDs for readability. Implementing phases incrementally to allow testing at each stage.
